Briefings in Bioinformatics 2021 XRRpred: accurate predictor of crystal structure quality from protein sequence. Ghadermarzi, S., Krawczyk, B., Song, J., & Kurgan, L. Bioinformatics Hu, G., Katuwawala, A., Wang, K., Wu, Z., Ghadermarzi, S., Gao, J., & Kurgan, L. (2021). flDPnn: Accurate intrinsic disorder prediction with putative propensities of disorder functions. Nature communications, 12(1), 1-8. Katuwawala, A., Ghadermarzi, S., Hu, G., Wu, Z., & Kurgan, L. (2021). QUARTERplus: Accurate disorder predictions integrated with interpretable residue-level quality assessment scores. Computational and structural biotechnology journal, 19, 2597-2606. Zhang, J., Ghadermarzi, S., & Kurgan, L. (2020). Prediction of protein-binding residues: dichotomy of sequence-based methods developed using structured complexes versus disordered proteins. Bioinformatics, 36(18), 4729-4738. Ghadermarzi, S., Li, X., Li, M., & Kurgan, L. (2019). Sequence-derived markers of drug targets and potentially druggable human proteins. Frontiers in genetics, 1075. Conference Publications # Ghadermarzi, S., Katuwawala, A., Oldfield, C. J., Barik, A., & Kurgan, L. (2019). Disordered Function Conjunction: On the in-silico function annotation of intrinsically disordered regions. In PACIFIC SYMPOSIUM ON BIOCOMPUTING 2020 (pp. 171-182). Book Chapters # Katuwawala, A., Ghadermarzi, S., & Kurgan, L. (2019). Computational prediction of functions of intrinsically disordered regions.
